page.title: 16LAKE DISTRICT NATIONAL PARK
page.content: The whole of this area is in the Lake District National Park and this imposes severe restrictions on the village.No building can be done without permission from the planning board which dictate the size, shape and building materials used.It is only in the last 5 years that any building has been allowed in Ravenglass at all and many people believe that much natural development has been stifled for example there is no garage in the area.However the planning board is reponsible for maintaining the car parks,public toilets and the footpaths which helps the appearance of the village.
